description: Manipulate Rackspace Cloud Block Storage Volume Attachments

identity_type.description: Authentication mechanism to use, such as rackspace or keystone.

tenant_id.description: The tenant ID used for authentication.

region.description: Region to create an instance in.

auth_endpoint.description: The URI of the authentication service.

verify_ssl.description: Whether or not to require SSL validation of API endpoints.

server.description: Name or id of the server to attach/detach

volume.description: Name or id of the volume to attach/detach

state.description: Indicate desired state of the resource

wait_timeout.description: how long before wait gives up, in seconds

env.description: Environment as configured in I(~/.pyrax.cfg), see U(https://github.com/rackspace/pyrax/blob/master/docs/getting_started.md#pyrax-configuration).

tenant_name.description: The tenant name used for authentication.

device.description: The device path to attach the volume to, e.g. /dev/xvde

credentials.description: File to find the Rackspace credentials in. Ignored if I(api_key) and I(username) are provided.

wait.description: wait for the volume to be in 'in-use'/'available' state before returning
